intro: Gymnogramma spuria, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pinnately divided fronds that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters called sori. Gymnogramma spuria is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas.
